subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS-SAMPA: a proposed format for plain-text Quickscript
msgSnippet: Couldn t that be handled with a TeX escape sequence or something? In other contexts, I think very few people need the backquote, which is one of the reasons I
messageBody:
Couldn't that be handled with a TeX escape sequence or something? In
other contexts, I think very few people need the backquote, which is
one of the reasons I suggested it. Another possibility I like is the
tilda, '~', but I think people would want to type a tilda once in a
while. I'm open to other possibilites that (1) are 7-bit ASCII, (2)
are easy to type, and (3) are visually reminiscent of the name dot.

Ted


On Dec 4, 2007 11:26 AM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
>
>
>
> Thanks for all your effort, Paul. It looks great. Aside from the
> alternate letters, the only thing I noticed is that the name dot is
> still mapped to '/'. Personally I'd like to be able to type '/' in QS,
> which is one of the reasons I proposed moving the name dot to the
> backquote key. Also, are you planning to add angle brackets
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I've added the angled brackets. I'm not so sure we should switch the naming
> dot to the backquote key however. The backquote is used extensively in TeX,
> which I use in laying out the news and other QS documents, so it seems too
> sacrifice a very usable character for one that is not used as much.
>
> You can find the font at the usual location:
>
> http://openfontlibrary.org/media/files/phthenry/217
>
> Paul
>
>
>
>
>
